headline.main: Science Votes No on California's Marijuana Plan

docs.abstract: Dr Mitchell S Rosenthal letter on Oct 30 article on California ballot initiative to legalize medical use of marijuana (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Your Oct. 30 news article on Proposition 215, the California ballot initiative that would make the medical use of marijuana legal, misses the point.
docs.snippet: To the Editor:    Your Oct. 30 news article on Proposition 215, the California ballot initiative that would make the medical use of marijuana legal, misses the point.

headline.main: Pesticides in Food, Children at Risk

docs.abstract: Yale University Prof John Wargo, in interview with Bill Slocum, discusses his new book, Our Children's Toxic Legacy, about danger of toxic chemicals in pesticides; photo (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: THE potential danger of toxic chemicals in pesticides has been called an ''invisible hazard,'' but for John Wargo of Westbrook, the evidence of continued contamination and its risks to humans is all too clear. Nearly a quarter-century after the Federal Government began banning toxic pesticides, Mr. Wargo, an associate professor of forestry, political science and environmental studies at Yale University, argues that the threat posed by pesticide use continues unabated.
